p: Tail Length (µm): The intubated-ICU patients exhibited a mean tail length of 22.4 μm, corresponding to the highest level of DNA damage. In comparison, non-intubated-ICU patients had a tail length of 15.4 μm, non-ICU patients had 7.9 μm, and healthy subjects showed a tail length of 3.8 μm. Each of these parameters indicated a significant increase in DNA damage in all three patient groups compared to healthy individuals (p < 0.01), with the highest damage observed in the intubated group.
